case_vignette: A 25-year-old male presents with 2 years of pruriginous erythematous plaques with silver scales on elbows, knees and buttocks. He says that his father is known for hand and back arthritis. He denies personal and family history of dermatology conditions and atopy. Physical exam reveals pitting on all 10 fingernails.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been dealing with itchy, red patches with silvery scales on my elbows, knees, and buttocks for two years.
Have you noticed these patches anywhere else on your body?
No, just on my elbows, knees, and buttocks.
Do the patches improve or worsen with any specific treatments or over time?
I didn't mention any changes regarding treatments or over time.
Have you tried any medications or treatments for your symptoms so far?
I didn't say whether I've tried any medications or treatments.
My apologies. Have you tried any medications or treatments for your symptoms?
No, I haven't mentioned trying any medications or treatments.
Do you have a personal or family history of psoriasis, eczema, or any other skin conditions?
I have no personal or family history of skin conditions.
Do you have joint pain or any changes in your nail appearance?
Yes, my fingernails have pitting on them.
**Final Diagnosis:** Psoriasis.
